text: Yeah, I was in the boy scouts at the time. And we was doing the 50-yard dash, racing,
keypoint: Participating in a boy scouts 50-yard dash

text: but we was at the pier, marked off, and so we was doing the 50-yard dash. There was about 8 or 9 of us, you know, going down, coming back.
keypoint: Race takes place at the pier with several participants

text: And, going down the third time, I caught cramps and I started yelling "Help!", but the fellows didn't believe me, you know. They thought I was just trying to catch up, because I was going on or slowing down.
keypoint: Cramps cause distress, cries for help ignored

text: So all of them kept going. They leave me. And so I started going down.
keypoint: Fellows continue racing, leaving him behind

text: Scoutmaster was up there. He was watching me. But he didn't pay me no attention either.
keypoint: Scoutmaster notices but does not intervene

text: And for no reason at all there was another guy, who had just walked up that minute... He just jumped over and grabbed me.
keypoint: A stranger arrives and rescues him
